oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1951-02-04 - Part 1 (alternate)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1951-02-04, part 1. Personnel include Don Estes (host, performer), Ott Devine (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer), Lion Chorus (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), Jim 'Lige' Sanders (performer), and Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys (performers) including Redd Steward (vocalist). This content is a longer version of TR001282_1. Marks drawn through the grooves suggest this version was not to be used.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Beasley Smith; Lion Orchestra; Don Estes; Dottie Dillard; Lion Chorus; Jim Sanders; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Redd Stewart
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Announcer opening statement -- 'S Wonderful (Don Estes vocals) -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine) -- Don Estes welcomes station KVMA to the Lion Network -- Don Estes and Dottie Dillard talk -- The Lonesomest Whistle (Dottie Dillard) -- Don Estes introduces Ott Devine and the Lion Chorus -- Lion Oil jingle (Lion Chorus) -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine) -- Lion Oil jingle (Lion Chorus) -- Don Estes introduces the next piece -- The Night Is Young And You're So Beautiful (Don Estes) -- Comedy routine (Don Estes, Dottie Dillard, Jim 'Lige' Sanders) -- Don Estes introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- Bonaparte's Retreat (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, Redd Stewart) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); KVMA (Radio station : Magnolia, Ark.); Estes, Don (Vocalist); Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Dillard, Dottie; Smith, Beasley; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Lion Chorus (Musical group); Sanders, Jim (Comedian); King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Stewart, Redd
